creator: wsmwk

content:
I would try and respond, but honestly I don't understand the question.

Perhaps this will assist as the steps cover most issues, not just memory. https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems

Personally I find most of the extreme performance issues stem from Third party products. SPAM/Scam toolbars and antivirus programs being my pet hates. They cripple the software often. I recommend an automatic exception for the Thunderbird profile folder in any antivirus product. If you are using IMAP, be aware simply deleting an email involved a round trip to the server and two interferences from antivirus in the process. One on the outgoing request and one on the reply and that does not matter if there is an exception or not. That is about file changes making the files unavailable when needed because they are now locked for scanning after each change. 50 deletions, 50 scans of the base storage file.

Is the program single threaded? Not for years. Just have a look in the Windows task manager.

The unified folder has been with Thunderbird since what version 3 I think. I have never fully trusted it, but many use nothing else. But there were issues with it post the version 115 release and the development team released an addon that can reset the unified folders as part of the debugging process. here https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/unified-folders-debugging/?src=ss

Back in September last year when the addon was released the information that came with my email notifying me was"For users who have issues with 115.3.0 or newer, they should be encouraged to use this tool, and file a bug report with the diagnostic output (created before they try to "fix" the issue)." I have no idea if there are still issues requiring bug to be filled, but if you have one I guess there are.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I will use some of your input thanks.

My basic problem is I click on the UI and it gets the click, it selects the item in the inbox listing, highlights it properly, but it never or greatly delayed (a minute) updates the right hand message to match. This seem like pretty easy stuff other than if it has to pull the email from the server but from looking at activity monitor I don't see it hanging there. If it can't take a click and immediately display the email message, like the top 10 items in the list which should be cached if not completely loaded, things are bad.

I will add that sometimes thunderbird just lose the click if it is trying to update the inbox index display and I click on an email just before it starts the update, it completely ignores my click. Seems from what I can see the UI is not getting highest priority.

I'll update if I figure it out what is going on cause this must be specific to me and thunderbird or no one would use it. This is super basic failure. It did not use to have this problem. Trying to figure out what/where something changed is my challenge.
creator: kvnmlm

content:
Labels are funny things. They can be uploaded to an IMAP server, if the server says it supports them, and "it does" Some do not actually advertise their support correctly so Thundebird sends the data and the server does not save it and because the server said it did Thunderbird does not save it either.

That one machine is not playing nicely, I would guess either a non IMAP configuration in Thunderbird, or some issues with antivirus loosing the uploads of label data.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Is this an IMAP account? And you have your own domain name and switched from one host to another? Please clarify the details. My 'guess' is that, if it is iMAP, the messages were still appearing on Thunderbird, but with a new server, there were no messages on the new server. So, since IMAP sync's to the server, the messages on PC would have been deleted. With more details, I may have guessed wrong.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thunderbird shows me result from all the emails that are disappeared.

Assuming you're talking about Global Search then what you see is what has previously been indexed. If your account is IMAP, as david already suspected, your messages are gone. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/global-search

You'd need to rebuild the search index to clean this up. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/rebuilding-global-database

Your problem sounds like your template folder is not designated as a templates folder as the templates folder has no right click on in a new window option.

Does your folder have the same icon as in the image beside it? How did you create your templates folder? If you do not have one it is automatically created by using the save as template action in the message write window.

content: My confusion is that you are stating that the messages are being returned because your account is spam. Generally, the term 'spam' refers to a message, not to an account. I am puzzled that mail is being bounced back because the account is a spammer, as I don't grasp the reasoning there. But, I don't know everything. You might approach your email provider to investigate why your account is not receiving, as Thunderbird is not in any way a part of that. Your email provider may also ask for the explicit message that senders are receiving, as the actual content of the message might be helpful to them.

content:
The first thing to check is the spam flag in the message list. Is it red/orange or grey. Grey indicates your provider is moving the mail to spam/ considers the email spam and Thunderbird does not see the item as spam.

Note that Yahoo do not have any way to influence their spam filters. You mark the message as not spam and move it somewhere else and within minutes yahoo will reverse your actions. A thoroughly poor implementation in my opinion. But they still dominate in the USA.
